text:
HPI:
   66 yo M with hx CLL, Hodgkin Lymphoma presenting with confusion and
   found to have multiple brain lesions that will require biopsy. Possible
   transformation of CLL into NHL.
   Chief complaint:
   confusion
   PMHx:
   CLL, Hodgkin's lymphoma, HPV anal warts, anal fissure, basal cell
   carcinoma, peripheral
   neuropathy
   Events: Pt frontal biopsy [**2119-11-10**] of lesion mets vs infectious. Pt
   extubated 0900 [**2119-11-11**] without difficulty. Now weened to RA.
   Altered mental status (not Delirium)
   Assessment:
   Pt Lethargic at times. Arousable to voice. + cough, + gag, + corneals.
   A/O X2-3- seems to have trouble with word finding. Pt very quiet. MAE
   with equal strengths. Speech normal just not able to get the words out
   at times- especially with Date. PERRLA.  Follows commands consistently.
   Biopsy sutures intact OTA no drainage noted. No c/o headache. Neuro
   checks done Q2hrs.
   Action:
   Neuro checks Q 2hrs.
   Response:
   Pt  neuro exam remains the same
   Plan:
   Awaiting pathology results.
